p.s: In the following analyseanalysis I will analyse the authorsauthor's intention by focusing on the use of stalisticstylistic devices.
In the first paragraph the author uses negative conotatedconnotated words like harmful pollutants, contaminate and hazardous to make the reader aware of the situation and the effects of our acts.
She uses this as an introduction to underline the bad situation because this stays in the readersreader's mind if itsit's said so directly.

In line five she wants express how simple our earth is made (air and water are two basic elements that sustain life), so the reader understands the basic elements without there wouldn't be any people, animals or plants (l. 6).
With that paragraph the author wants to make the readers see the beauty in earth and how it havehas flourished (l. 8) before she argues about the causes and effects of pollution.
In line twelve ... that man first began losing control and became victim of his own creations she says, that all the anchievementsachievements of humans get back as problems.
By using the word victim she accuses human for the pollution.
She wants to make the reader think about the problem and try to find solutions.
This she confirms with at the cost of our health in line 15.
The author makes the readers feel accused by building an emotional bond to the reader.
In line 18 she uses a methaphormetaphor the blind alleys of adversity.
She wants to make the reader aware of the problem and that there will be no other planet if we don't change something and find a solution.
With the example of the tragedy (l. 28-32) and the thougtthought of experts (l. 33-36) she wants to make people think of solutions.
With the facts of the tragedy she wants to show how bad it can get.
By adding the worried experts she has a proof so the readers take the environmental pollution more serious and think about changing things.
All in all the author uses a lot of negativnegative conotativeconnotative words so that the reader takes everything more serious and understands the bad situation.
